TESTCASES.PROFILE: University of Edinburgh tests for XML 1.0 5th edition
TESTCASES.TEST: Byte order mark in general entity should go away (big-endian)
Byte order mark in general entity should go away (little-endian)
Byte order mark in general entity should go away (utf-8)
Two byte order marks in general entity produce only one (big-endian)
Two byte order marks in general entity produce only one (little-endian)
Two byte order marks in general entity produce only one (utf-8)
A byte order mark and a backwards one in general entity cause an illegal char. error (big-endian)
A byte order mark and a backwards one in general entity cause an illegal char. error (little-endian)
A byte order mark and a backwards one in general entity cause an illegal char. error (utf-8)
Character '゚' is a CombiningChar, not a Letter, but as of 5th edition, may begin a name (c.f. xmltest/not-wf/sa/140.xml).
As of 5th edition, character #x0E5C is legal in XML names (c.f. xmltest/not-wf/sa/141.xml).
a document with version=1.7, illegal in XML 1.0 through 4th edition
a document with version=1.7, legal in XML 1.0 from 5th edition
Has a "long s" in a name, legal in XML 1.1, legal in XML 1.0 5th edition
Has a "long s" in a name, legal in XML 1.1, legal in XML 1.0 5th edition
Has a Byzantine Musical Symbol Kratimata in a name, legal in XML 1.1, legal in XML 1.0 5th edition
Has the last legal namechar in XML 1.1, legal in XML 1.0 5th edition
